main.name: Floyd Chen
main.occupation: Senior Computer Science Student graduating December 2018
main.description: I am a Frontend React / Full Stack Developer seeking full-time position
bio: • Actively looking for a frontend / full stack entry level developer position
• React developer. Contributed a lot to a React Component UI Library during summer 2018 and built multiple full stack React applications.
• Senior computer science student graduating in December 2018
• 2 years of hands-on coding experience with a solid algorithm, data structure, and fundamentals background.
• web dev skills: JavaScript, React.js, Node.js, Express.js, GraphQL, HTML, Bootstrap, CSS, Sass, RESTFul, MongoDB

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
description: • Contributed as one of the core developers to React Atlast, an open-source React UI Library that is actively used as the UI standard by Digital River and is one of the core projects of Digital River’s front end team.
• Created and solved 5% of the total issues of the UI Library by testing, solving major bugs and enhancing components.
• Added, rewrote and stabilized major components; developed new UI demo site to replace the old jQuery demos.
• Developed a user guide center web widget and its components including Walkthrough, Tooltip and Lightbox, etc.

work.title: WebDev Research Assistant
description: • Used MERN stack(MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) and GraphQL to re-develop from scratch and maintain the website for Metro Food Access Network (MFAN), a University of Minnesota based non-profit organization.
• Used D3.js to create visualized force directed graphs and geomaps for MFAN partners data.

projects.title: Metro Food Access Network
projects.category: MFAN works to make healthy foods accessible to Twin Cities residents.

projects.title: React Atlas
projects.category: a React component library, with a focus on supplying Admin Interface tools

projects.title: Find Your Dream Campgrounds
projects.category: a full stack RESTful website to display and store campgrounds data

projects.title: Football Injury Predictor
projects.category: a web-app that utilizes machine learning to predict chances of injury for football players

testimonials.text: Floyd is a passionate, inquisitive, and self-driven student of Software Engineering. With an equal level of interest in both "why" and "how", Floyd sets himself apart from his peers with an infectious energy level that helps to motivate anybody around him. His short time as an Intern at Digital River provided immediate value for the company as he came in ready to work, learn, and listen. He was willing to do any type of work, tackled problems that had perplexed veteran engineers, and asked lots of questions. I would absolutely recommend him for any type of role he pursues as he will find a way to succeed, no matter what his background or challenges are placed in his way.
testimonials.user: Derek Harper, Sr. Software Engineering Manager at Digital River
